description:
Somewhere out there could be an alternate universe where Microsoft exists without Windows, but probably not. Microsoft without Windows is almost unimaginable, given how globally popular the operating system has become over the decades.

Related: A history of Windows’ most pivotal events

Get Windows 11 Pro for cheap
title: Did you know Microsoft tried to scrap Windows and start over?

description:
Take a deep breath, everyone. Logitech’s “forever mouse” won’t be coming to market after all.

Logitech’s idea of a mouse that you’d buy once and pay for forever is just a “peek” into a possible future, Logitech said, in a statement sent to PCWorld and other publications. The company has no plans to bring it to market and will keep selling its existing mice, which you pay for, then own for the life of the mouse.

Newly-minted Logitech CEO Hanneke Faber suggested the idea of a forever mouse in an interview with The Verge, where she suggested that the concept of constantly paying for updates was somehow like buying a luxury item. The idea is that you’d constantly pay a fee to update the mouse with drivers and new features and hold onto it…forever?

The Internet erupted. As
title: Logitech: ‘Forever mouse’ was just a (bad) idea

description:
If you think phishing scams only happen over the internet, you’d be dead wrong. In fact, there are many different types of phishing scams, including a recent type that occurs via traditional mail.

In Germany, the State Office of Criminal Investigation of Lower Saxony recently warned people about phishing attempts via mail in the form of fake letters that purport to come from their banks.

Some of these phishing letters look surprisingly close to the real deal, and some even contain personalized information. Complete with official logos, they give the impression that they’re authentic.

Known cases have impersonated Commer
title: Beware of this new phishing scam that could arrive in your mailbox

description:
Upgrading your living room, gaming room, or even bedroom can be as simple as adding a couple Govee smart light bars to the back of your TV or monitor—and now you can do so at a discount because they’re down to $35 on Amazon when normally they’d be $50.

Usually available for $50, these light bars will help you set the right vibe for what you’re playing or what you’re watching.

These smart LED light bars look gorgeous and they’re so versatile because you can use them in their stands (either horizontally or vertically) or you can attach them to the backs of TVs and monitors.

The Govee Smart LED Light Bars can also sync to your music with their built-in high-sensitivity microphones, so that they pulse to the rhythm of songs, movies, or even
title: Enliven your home with Govee’s smart RGB light bars, now $35

description:
You know that warning that pops up every time you want to install a new app in Windows? The one that sometimes prevents you from doing it when an app seems a little sketchy? Yeah, it’s busted… and it’s been busted—for at least six years—according to recent security research.

title: Windows SmartScreen security has been compromised for years

description:
With back-to-school discounts popping up all over the place, it’s no surprise to see laptops on sale—but it is surprising to see this HP Victus gaming laptop drop to such a stunning price.

Usually sold for $979, this 15.6-inch HP Victus laptop is now just $599 at Walmart. That’s a huge savings of $380 on a powerful machine that’s perfect for gamers and creators alike.

It features a 15.6-inch IPS display with a 1080p resolution and 144Hz refresh rate. The high resolution ensures you have a crisp experience whatever it is you’re doing on your computer, from reading documents to watching videos to playing games.

The HP Victus runs on an AMD Ryzen 5 processor and 8GB of DDR5 RAM. (If you want more, you can add an extra 8GB memory
title: This RTX-powered HP Victus gaming laptop is a steal at just $599

description:
It’s been a few months since Nvidia introduced its new omnibus app that combines driver updates with other settings and tools for gamers. The Windows app is still in beta, but it just got a significant update that packs in more features and an Xbox Game Pass freebie.

According to Nvidia’s blog post, the latest version of the app includes more direct control for monitor features, like manually setting resolution and refresh rate. The new System panel on the left-side column also includes controls for
title: Nvidia app adds more options and a free month of Xbox Game Pass

description:
Whether you’re capturing a snippet of important information or a funny moment in a game, taking a screenshot is something most people do on a day-to-day basis. Taking a screenshot is relatively straightforward, but there are smarter ways to do it. Windows 11’s screen capture tools are a lot more advanced than the ones Windows 10 offers. Heck, you can even film what appears on the screen!

In our guide, we lay out all the tips between the two systems. Read on to learn more.

Powerful screen capture tool
title: How to take smarter screenshots in Windows 11

description:
If you’re dealing with the aches and pains from sitting in an old office chair and are looking to replace it with a new one, you’ve come to the right place. Staples is currently selling the Hyken Ergonomic Mesh Swivel Task Chair for just $99, plus free shipping — a humongous discount from its usual $300 price tag. This specific chair is the chair of choice among Reddit’s chair nerd hivemind at r/buildapc, so you know it has serious staying power.

Sure, it’s a Reddit favorite, but I also happen to own this exact chair model and can confidently vouch its comfort and ergonomics. I’ve been using it for years at this point! Back pain? Sore shoulder? Never heard of them.

Looking for more d
title: Reddit’s favorite desk chair is a humongous 66% off

description:
If you find it hard to work on-the-go because a single laptop screen is too limited, then what you need is a portable monitor—like this sleek 15.6-incher by Arzopa that’s seriously only $60 right now on Amazon, a huge drop from its usual $130 price tag.

This travel monitor is a great blend of portability and functionality, making it the perfect accessory if you need an extra screen while working or a display for your handheld gaming console.

The 15.6-inch IPS display has a 1080p resolution, a 60Hz refresh rate, and an anti-glare coating for minimal eye strain. It delivers vibrant colors and sharp images no matter what you’re reading, watching, or playing.

Perhaps the best part is that it’s entirely plug-and-play. You can use a single USB-C
title: Get this $130 portable laptop monitor for just $60 right now

description:
Hardly a week goes by without a company, an organization, or a hospital falling victim to a ransomware attack. Their computer systems have been attacked by an extortion virus that encrypts all files and only releases them again upon payment of a high ransom. Yet the computers of almost all victims are protected by an antivirus program. How can this be?

Further reading: Best antivirus software 2024: Keep your PC safe from malware, spyware, and more

1. Sheer quantity of attacks

Back in 2023, we asked anti-virus expert Andreas Marx of AV-Test how so many infections escape antiviru
title: 5 devious ways malware can sneak past your PC’s antivirus

description:
It’s that time of year again, folks. Whether you’re a freshman heading off to college for the first time or a returning student, you’re going to need a good laptop that will last you through your school years (and maybe beyond!). But finding the right laptop for your needs can be like searching for a needle in a haystack–daunting. What screen size should you spring for? Do you really need an all-powerful processor for research and general web browsing? Fortunately, I can help.

In addition to overseeing PCWorld’s laptop reviews, I also maintain our top pick roundups such as best laptops and best Chromebooks. Notebooks are my job, so I know what to look for in a college laptop. If you’re not
title: 6 must-have features in any college laptop
